Introduction.Name: Dwarfs
Introduction.Annotation: The Dwarfs, also called the "Elder Race" (or the Dawi as they call themselves) are one of the oldest and proudest intelligent races of the Warhammer World, with a great wealth of history and power that stretches back to time immemorial. They once held an empire which stretched from Norsca in the north to the jungles in the south, and from Mount Silverspear in the east to the Grey Mountains in the west. But the heart of the Dwarfen realm, the Karaz Ankor as they call it, will always lie within the domains of the Worlds Edge Mountains. The highest mountain range in the world, it is filled with the magnificent halls and holds of the Dwarfen people - a testament to the great feats of engineering and power once wielded by this ancient civilization.

Weapon.Name: Master Rune of Snorri Spangelhelm
Weapon.Description: Any blows struck by a weapon engraved with this rune will always hit. No roll to hit is necessary.

Weapon.Name: Master Rune of Skalf Blackhammer
Weapon.Description: Any weapon bearing this rune will automatically wound if it hits. Roll to hit as normal. No roll to wound is required. Use the character's Strength for the save modifier.

Weapon.Name: Master Rune of Alaric the Mad
Weapon.Description: This rune cancels an opponent's armour saving throw. When wounded by this weapon, the target is not allowed an armour saving throw of any kind.

Weapon.Name: Master Rune of Flight
Weapon.Rule: Weapon can be thrown like a throwing weapon with a range of up to 12" which always hits as if the target had suffered a hit from the weapon in close combat
Weapon.Description: This rune may only be inscribed onto a hammer. The hammer can be thrown at any model in sight and within 12", including models which cannot be singled out by normal shooting (like characters inside units). The target is automatically hit once as if the two models were in close combat, then the hammer flies back into the wielder's hand.

Weapon.Name: Master Rune of Breaking
Weapon.Rule: If character scores a hit against an enemy with a magic weapon, the enemy's magic weapon is destroyed immediately
Weapon.Description: If the Dwarf character scores a hit against an enemy with a magic weapon, the enemy's magic weapon is destroyed immediately. Multiple runes have no further effect.

Weapon.Name: Master Rune of Swiftness
Weapon.Description: A weapon engraved with this rune always strikes first. In situations where both sides are entitled to strike first, the highest Initiative value has priority over the lower value. If Initiatives are equal, both sides roll a D6 and the highest score strikes first.

Weapon.Name: Rune of Might
Weapon.Rule: Doubles Strength against foes of Toughness 5 or higher in close combat
Weapon.Description: Double Strength against any enemies with Toughness 5 or more. Multiple runes have no further effect.

Weapon.Name: Rune of Fury
Weapon.Description: The wielder of this weapon adds +1 to his Attack characteristic.

Weapon.Name: Rune of Cleaving
Weapon.Description: The wielder of this weapon adds +1 to his Strength.

Weapon.Name: Grudge Rune
Weapon.Rule: Nominate one enemy character or monster at the beginning of the game: the model may re-roll misses in close combat when attacking this enemy model
Weapon.Description: Nominate one enemy character or monster at the beginning of the game. The wielder may re-roll misses in close combat when attacking this enemy model. Multiple runes of this type have no additional effect (a dice can only be re-rolled once).

Weapon.Name: Rune of Striking
Weapon.Description: The wielder of this weapon may add +1 to his Weapon Skill.

Weapon.Name: Rune of Speed
Weapon.Description: The wielder of this weapon adds +1 to his Initiative.

Weapon.Name: Rune of Fire
Weapon.Description: Flaming attacks. This can cause extra damage on some targets (such as Treemen, Mummies, etc).

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Steel
AdditionalArmour.Description: Your opponent must re-roll successful rolls to wound against the character.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Adamant
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune adds + 1 to the Toughness of the character.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Gromril
AdditionalArmour.Description: Confers a 1+ armour save that cannot be improved in any way.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Fortitude
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune gives its bearer +1 Wound.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Shielding
AdditionalArmour.Rule: 2+ Ward save against missile attacks only
AdditionalArmour.Description: The character has a 2+ Ward save against missile attacks only (including magic missiles). Multiple runes have no further effect.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Resistance
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune allows the character to re-roll any failed armour saving throws. As you're only ever allowed one re-roll, multiples of this rune would have no effect.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Iron
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune confers a 6+ Ward save. Two of these runes confer a 5+ Ward save, but three cannot be taken, because only the-Master Rune of Spite can bind such huge power.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Iron
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune confers a 6+ Ward save. Two of these runes confer a 5+ Ward save, but three cannot be taken, because only the-Master Rune of Spite can bind such huge power.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Stone
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune adds +1 to the character's Armour save. The Rune of Stone is an exception to the normal Rule of Pride which forbids the same combination of runes to be used on several items, so a single Rune of Stone may be inscribed onto any character's armour. The Rune of Stone is also an exception in that it cannot be used more than once on the same item, so it is not possible to give two or three Runes of Stone to the same character.

Banner.Name: Master Rune of Valaya
Banner.Rule: Any spell which remains in play is dispelled automatically at the start of the Magic phase if the target it affects is within 12"
Banner.Description: This rune adds +2 to all attempts to dispel made by the Dwarf player. Any spell which remains in play is dispelled automatically at the start of the Magic phase if the target it affects is within 12" of the standard. For example, a Wall of Fire will be dispelled if it is within 12" of the standard.

Banner.Name: Master Rune of Stromni Redbeard
Banner.Description: The Battle Standard adds a further +1 to the combat result of all Dwarf units within 12" of it.

Banner.Name: Master Rune of Taunting
Banner.Rule: Nominate one enemy unit within 12" when it is time for the enemy to declare charges: the enemy unit must either declare a charge against the unit or must flee in the Compulsory Movement phase as if it had failed a panic test
Banner.Description: Nominate one enemy unit within 12" when it is time for the enemy to declare charges. The unit must be able to charge according to the normal rules. The enemy unit must either declare a charge against the unit with the banner, or must flee in the Compulsory Movement phase as if it had failed a panic test. This rune has no effect on units that are Immune to Psychology.

Banner.Name: Master Rune of Fear
Banner.Description: The unit causes fear exacdy as described in the psychology rules. A unit which causes fear is not affected by fear itself.

Banner.Name: Rune of Courage
Banner.Description: The unit is Immune to Psychology.

Banner.Name: Rune of Kadrin
Banner.Description: The unit re-rolls all rolls of 1 to hit when shooting and in close combat. Multiple runes have no further effect.

Banner.Name: Rune of Slowness
Banner.Rule: Any foes charging the unit subtract D6" from their charge distance
Banner.Description: Any foes charging the unit subtract D6" from their charge distance. If the unit fails to make contact then all the usual rules for a failed charge apply. If multiples of this rune are used, the charge reduction is not added up, instead roll a D6 for each rune and choose the best score.

Banner.Name: Rune of Battle
Banner.Description: The unit adds a further +1 to its combat result score. A banner cannot have multiple Runes of Battle.

Banner.Name: Rune of Sanctuary
Banner.Rule: +1 dice to any dispel attempt against enemy spells cast against the unit
Banner.Description: Each rune adds one dice to any dispel attempt against enemy spells cast against the unit.

Banner.Name: Rune of Sanctuary
Banner.Rule: +2 dice to any dispel attempt against enemy spells cast against the unit

Banner.Name: Rune of Sanctuary
Banner.Rule: +3 dice to any dispel attempt against enemy spells cast against the unit

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Defence
AdditionalArmour.Rule: All incoming missiles (including magic missiles) hit the machine itself on a 1-5 and the crew only on a 6

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Disguise
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Until it moves or shoots, the machine cannot be seen
AdditionalArmour.Description: Until it moves or shoots, the machine cannot be seen, and cannot therefore be targeted with spells, shot at, or charged. Once the machine has moved fired, or if an enemy unit moves to within 3" of it, the machine is revealed and can be Seen and attacked as normal for the rest of the battle.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Immolation
AdditionalArmour.Rule: The Dwarf player can cause the machine to explode at any time (large circular template, all models under the template suffer a Strength 4 hit, models partially covered are hit on the roll of a 4+
AdditionalArmour.Description: The Dwarf player can cause the machine to explode at any time. If the machine explodes, place the large circular template on the machine. The machine is destroyed and all models under the template suffer a Strength 4 hit (models partially covered are hit on the roll of a 4+).

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Skewering
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Once per game the Bolt Thrower hits on a 2+ with no modifiers
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune may only be inscribed on a Bolt Thrower. Once per game the Bolt Thrower hits on a 2+ with no modifiers. You must choose to use this rune before rolling to hit.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Forging
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Allows to re-roll Artillery dice when he rolls a Misfire
AdditionalArmour.Description: Can only be placed on a cannon. Allows Dwarf player to re-roll Artillery dice when he rolls a Misfire. If you roll a Misfire when rolling Artillery dice either to hit or to bounce, then you can roll again. You are bound by the second roll even if it's another Misfire. Multiples have no effect.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Reloading
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Can shoot every turn, as long as there is at least one crewman left
AdditionalArmour.Description: Cannon can shoot every turn, as long as there is at least one crewman left, even if the machine has rolled a 2-3 on the Misfire table in the previous turn. Multiples have no effect.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Accuracy
AdditionalArmour.Rule: May re-roll the Scatter dice
AdditionalArmour.Description: May only be put on a Stone Thrower. The Dwarf player may re-roll the Scatter dice if he wishes, enabling the machine to shoot more accurately. If you re-roll the dice, you must accept the result of the second roll. Multiples have no effect.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Fortune
AdditionalArmour.Rule: May re-roll a dice rolled on the machine's Misfire chart
AdditionalArmour.Description: If a machine has the Rune of Fortune the player may re-roll a dice rolled on the machine's Misfire chart. For example, you can re-roll a result on the Cannon Misfire chart, or the Misfire chart for Stone Throwers. However, you must accept the result of the second dice roll. Multiples have no effect.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Valiant Rune
AdditionalArmour.Description: As long as their war machine is not destroyed, the war machine crew are Unbreakable.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Penetrating
AdditionalArmour.Rule: The Strength of a hit from the war machine increases by +1

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Penetrating
AdditionalArmour.Rule: The Strength of a hit from the war machine increases by +2

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Penetrating
AdditionalArmour.Rule: The Strength of a hit from the war machine increases by +3

AdditionalArmour.Name: Flakkson's Rune of Seeking
AdditionalArmour.Rule: +1 to hit rolls against targets with the Fly special ability
AdditionalArmour.Description: Each rune adds +1 to the bolt thrower's to hit rolls against targets with the Fly special ability.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Flakkson's Rune of Seeking
AdditionalArmour.Rule: +2 to hit rolls against targets with the Fly special ability

AdditionalArmour.Name: Flakkson's Rune of Seeking
AdditionalArmour.Rule: +3 to hit rolls against targets with the Fly special ability

AdditionalArmour.Name: Stalwart Rune
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune adds +1 to the crew's combat resolution score.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Burning
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Flaming Attacks
AdditionalArmour.Description: The war engine makes flaming attacks.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Kingship
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune may only be engraved on the crown of a Dwarf Lord. The Lord and the unit he leads are stubborn and completely immune to fear and terror.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Balance
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Remove one dice from the opponent's pile of Power dice and add it to his own Dispel dice pile
AdditionalArmour.Description: During the enemy's Magic phase, this rune allows the Dwarf player to remove one dice from the opponent's pile of Power dice and add it to his own Dispel dice pile.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Spellbinding
AdditionalArmour.Rule: +1 to all attempts to dispel

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Spite
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune confers a 4+ Ward save.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Master Rune of Dismay
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Once per battle, at the end of the Dwarf player's turn, all enemy units on the field which are not Immune to Psychology must take a Leadership test, if they fail, they are so dismayed that they may not declare a charge in their following turn's Movement phase
AdditionalArmour.Description: The horn may be sounded once per battle, at the end of the Dwarf player's turn. All enemy units on the field which are not Immune to Psychology must take a Leadership test. If they fail, they are so dismayed that they may not declare a charge in their following turn's Movement phase. Units that move in the compulsory Movement phase are not affected.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Spelleater Rune
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Once per battle, may automatically dispel one enemy spell, roll of a 4+ the enemy spell is lost and can't be cast again for the rest of the game
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune may only be used once per battle, and will stop enemy magic instantly. The rune may be played to automatically dispel one enemy spell - there is no need to roll. This rune won't help against spells cast with Irresistable Force. Also, when the enemy spell is cancelled, roll a dice. On the roll of a 4+ the enemy spell is lost and can't be cast again for the rest of the game.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Fate
AdditionalArmour.Description: The model has a 2+ Ward save against the first wound suffered.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Spellbreaking
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Once per battle, may automatically dispel one enemy spell
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune may only be used once per battle, and will stop enemy magic instantly. The rune may be played to automatically dispel one enemy spell - there is no need to roll. This rune won't help against spells cast with Irresistable Force.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Luck
AdditionalArmour.Rule: May re-roll any 1 dice roll during the game
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune allows its bearer to re-roll any single dice roll once during the game.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Luck
AdditionalArmour.Rule: May re-roll any 2 dice roll during the game

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Luck
AdditionalArmour.Rule: May re-roll any 3 dice roll during the game

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Warding
AdditionalArmour.Rule: +1 dice to any attempt to dispel enemy spells cast against the character or the unit he is with
AdditionalArmour.Description: This rune adds a dice to any attempt to dispel enemy spells cast against the character or the unit he is with.

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Warding
AdditionalArmour.Rule: +2 dice to any attempt to dispel enemy spells cast against the character or the unit he is with

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of Warding
AdditionalArmour.Rule: +3 dice to any attempt to dispel enemy spells cast against the character or the unit he is with

AdditionalArmour.Name: Rune of the Furnace
AdditionalArmour.Rule: Immune to fire and cannot be affected by fire attacks
AdditionalArmour.Description: The bearer of this rune is immune to fire and cannot be affected by fire attacks (including magical fire, the flames of a Skaven warpfire thrower, etc).

Lord.Name: Thorek Ironbrow
Lord.Description: Thorek Ironbrow, Master Runelord of Karak Azul

HandWeapon.Name: Klad Brakak
HandWeapon.Rule: If the victim suffers one or more unsaved Wounds, any magic armour, magic helmets and magic shields they were equipped with are destroyed and cannot be used for the remainder of the game

Lord.Name: King Alrik Ranulfsson
Lord.Description: Dwarf King Alrik Ranulfsson of Karak-Hirn

Individual.Rule: Friendly Dwarfs within 18" of him may use his Leadership value, rather than those within 12" as normal
Gyrocopters, Flame Cannons and Organ Guns cost twice the points they do normally, army cannot have more models armed with a handgun than a crossbow

HandWeapon.Name: Axe of Retribution
HandWeapon.Rule: Nominate one enemy character or monster at the beginning of the game: the model may re-roll misses in close combat when attacking this enemy model
If character scores a hit against an enemy with a magic weapon, the enemy's magic weapon is destroyed immediately

Armour.Name: Hrappi-klad
Armour.Rule: 2+ Ward save against missile attacks only

Armour.Name: Helm of Eagles
Armour.Rule: At the start of each Dwarf turn, Alrik may gaze at one enemy unit: opponent must reveal any hidden troops within the unit as well as all magic items carried by models within the unit

Armour.Name: Karak-Hirn's Book of Grudges
Armour.Rule: In battle, this has the effect of allowing friendly units within 12" of King Alrik to re-roll failed break tests, just like an army standard

Pistol.Dependencies: Off: Great weapon, Brace of pistols

Individual.Rule: Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
Do not need to pass a Leadership test in order to march, regardless of the proximity of enemy
+1 bonus to any Parry save in a turn in which unit is charged
Dwarfs always have the Hatred Orcs, Goblins and Skaven
